page.title: 13The Acorn Public House.
page.content: The Acorn is situated in the Stifford Clays estate.It was built in 1954 and at present is owned by Charrington's.The pub has 12 staff,comprising of 3 cleaners,7 barstaff,manager and manageress.It has two main bars and a function room which caters for parties,receptions etc.In the public bar there are 3 pool tables,a dartboard, fruit machine and juke box. The cellar is kept spotless and stores barrels and bottles which are kept at a temperature of 57 degrees Farenheit.At present,7 out of 10 customers prefer lager to beer with the average price of a pint being 80p. The pub is open at regulated hours each day,with the weekend being the busiest time.Customers must be 18 years old before they can enter and consume alcohol on the premises.
